title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: A story about a young Andalusian shepherd named Santiago who sets out on a journey to discover his personal legend.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society, exploring themes of government oppression and psychological manipulation.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: Set in the 1930s, it tells the story of a young girl, Scout Finch, and her father, Atticus, a lawyer defending a black man accused of rape.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: The novel explores themes of decadence, idealism, resistance to change, and social upheaval in the Jazz Age.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A classic novel depicting the societal issues of 19th-century England, focusing on the dynamics of class, love, and marriage.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: Follows the story of Holden Caulfield, a young man in New York City, dealing with issues of identity, belonging, and the 'phoniness' of the adult world.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An epic fantasy novel involving a quest to destroy a powerful ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: Follows the story of a young wizard, Harry Potter, and his adventures at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: A fantasy novel about the journey of Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
summary: A mystery thriller that follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he investigates a murder in the Louvre Museum and discovers a hidden secret.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
summary: A crime novel involving journalist Mikael Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander as they work together to solve a cold case.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
summary: Set in a dystopian future, it follows a young girl named Katniss Everdeen as she participates in a brutal televised event called the Hunger Games.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
summary: A comedic science fiction series that follows the adventures of Arthur Dent after Earth's destruction to make way for a hyperspace bypass.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
summary: Set in a futuristic world, it explores a dystopian society, where emotions and individuality are suppressed in the name of social stability.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
summary: A post-apocalyptic novel following a father and son's journey across a desolate landscape, facing the challenges of survival.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
summary: A story about the bond between two boys in Afghanistan and the consequences of betrayal and redemption.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
summary: The story of Ishmael's voyage on the whaling ship Pequod and his obsession with the elusive white whale, Moby Dick.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
summary: An exploration of the consequences of scientific discovery and the ethics of creation, as Dr. Frankenstein brings a creature to life.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: A novel about a man whose portrait ages while he remains youthful, delving into themes of vanity, morality, and the consequences of one's actions.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
summary: The story of Edmond Dant√®s, who, after being wrongfully imprisoned, seeks revenge against those who betrayed him.
